commit_list.message:
Look for plugin assets in ~/.nylas-dev when in dev mode

Nylas creates a protocol handler for nylas:// on startup. It adds a
number of paths to this, including the plugins directory. However,
when in normal mode the plugins directory is under ~/.nylas-mail, and
when in dev mode the plugins directory is under ~/.nylas-dev. The
protocol handler doesn't take this into consideration, and loads the
plugin directories under ~/.nylas-mail all the time. This means plugin
assets aren't loaded correctly when in dev mode.

This change passes the config directory to the protocol handler
creation code so it uses the correct directory.
commit_list.repo_description: :love_letter: An extensible desktop mail app built on the modern web.

commit_list.message:
Remove delta connections code

This is only used for syncing with the N1CloudAPI, which is the API
interface to Nylas's cloud servers.  Nylas removed support for syncing
email with their cloud servers in a September code release aimed at
making it easier to run as a community project.

This code is no longer being used anywhere besides the developer bar,
which is monitor for now non-existant DeltaConnection for use when
debugging the application.
commit_list.repo_description: :love_letter: An extensible desktop mail app built on the modern web.

commit_list.message:
Remove of code that ping nylas servers on IMAP signup

When Nylas (the company) dropped supported for Nylas Mail and released
a version more suited for an open-source project they removed a number
of calls to the Nylas cloud API that was used to sync email. However,
they left in a call to the API that was triggered on signing up with
an IMAP/SMTP account. This call sends the details of the SMTP
authentication to Nylas's servers. The servers then, at a minimum,
attempt a connection to the SMTP server and return an error if that
fails. If it succeeds, the API returns an API token for Nylas Mail to
use with future connections to the API.

This commit removes the API call, as it's no longer useful and in fact
gets in the way when attempting to connect to a local SMTP server. It
also removes code that stores the API token, and some code that checks
that the API token exists. An API call with the same data to a *local*
API is left.
commit_list.repo_description: :love_letter: An extensible desktop mail app built on the modern web.

commit_list.message:
Match \Seen and \Flagged system flags in case-insensitive manner

In RFC 3501, system flags are defined as being
case-insensitive. However, Nylas currently looks for the exact strings
"\Seen" and "\Flagged". This causes compatibility issues when a server
returns \SEEN or \FLAGGED.

Fixes #61
commit_list.repo_description: :love_letter: An extensible desktop mail app built on the modern web.

commit_list.message:
[feat] Go to first open line when enter is pressed

When filling out the signup or login pages, and when adding an
additional service provider, the enter key will trigger the submit
action. When on the choose provider page, enter will take you to the
next page.

- Resolves: #8841
commit_list.repo_description: Bitmask desktop client

commit_list.message:
[bug] correctly handle authenticate's autoconf parameter

This fixes two bugs with handling the autoconf parameter:
 - It looks for "True" instead of "true" in the dispatching code to
   account for json.dumps() converting true into a boolean and str()
   returning the python-style capitalized version "True".
 - It moves the initial definitions of offirst_bootstrap,
   ongoing_bootstrap, and stuck_bootstrap into the class instantiation
   method so they don't get shared between instances of the
   class. Previously, this caused one instance being bootstrapped to
   causes other instances to think they were also actively being
   bootstrapped.

Resolves #8843
commit_list.repo_description: Bitmask desktop client

commit_list.message:
[feat] add icon to account list indicating account with active VPN

This adds a lock icon to the account list next to the account with the
currently active VPN. The icon is green if the VPN is connected,
yellow if the VPN is connectiong, and red in any other case.

- Resolves: #8853
commit_list.repo_description: Bitmask desktop client

commit_list.message:
[bug] Don't update VPN status component for wrong domain

Previously, if the active VPN was in the connecting state and the VPN
status component for another account was rendered the status for the
new account would show as connecting. This was because it didn't check
the domain returned from the status endpoint when parsing the returned
data and setting "connecting" as the status. We can safely assume that
a non active VPN is in the "down" state, so that's what this commit
does.
commit_list.repo_description: Bitmask desktop client

instead it needs display: -webkit-flex.

[bug] explicitly set versions for peer dependencies

Newer versions of npm don't autoinstall peer dependencies, so they
have to be explicitly installed in package.json. This adds the few
that npm was complaining about.

[feat] Add 7bit to the list of supported encodings

This is required for Nylas to be able to send emails though bitmask.
commit_list.repo_description: Bitmask desktop client

commit_list.message:
[bug] Keep content-type when it is set in message headers

When content-type was set in the message headers instead of the
MIMEPart (e.g. when not using MIMEParts in the message) bitmask would
ignore it and add the content as text/plain. This caused problems with
Nylas.

To fix this, if the message is not Multipart I'm keeping the
assumption that everything is going to have the maintype of "text" but
copying the subtype from the original message.

This also decodes the original message's payload before attaching the
old content to the new message to make up for the loss of encoding
information.

-Resolves: #9064
commit_list.repo_description: Bitmask desktop client

commit_list.message:
Allow user to change wordlist locale

Previously the locale could only be change by setting the LANG
environment variable. This commit adds support for mor easily changing
the locale of the wordlist to any of the supported locales shipped
with phrasebook. It can be changed either via the file menu or the new
command line flag "--locale".

commit_list.message:
Don't allow too short of a password to be generated

Previously phrasebook showed an error message if the number of words
in the word list and passphrase had too little entropy. Now it simple
doesn't let you set the number of words that low.

commit_list.repo_description: Multilingual desktop application for generating secure passphrases with random words

commit_list.message:
Detect a user's locale and select a language file based off of it

This attempts to provide a user with a set of words in the language
matching their locale. It first looks for a word list that matches
both the locale and territory in their locale string (e.g. fr_FR). If
it fails to find one, it looks for a wordlist appropriate for their
language (e.g. fr). If that fails, it falls back to English.
